title: Three in jail after Howard’s night club shooting February 14
content:
GREENE COUNTY, Ala. (IWAT) — UPDATE: Three suspects, including the owner of Howard’s, have been arrested in connection with a shooting incident which took place February 14.
Avery Lynn Hughes, 23 of Eutaw and LaDexter Tequan Pelt, 19 of Eutaw have both accrued several charges ranging from attempted murder to assault.
Additionally, Percy Howard Crawford, 75 of Eutaw, is charged with tampering with physical evidence. Crawford is the owner of the nightclub.
All suspects are in the Greene County Jail at this time.
ORIGINAL: The Greene County Sheriff’s Office is investigating an early Sunday shooting.
Five people were shot inside Howard’s club in the Union Area. Two have been released from the hospital and three remain hospitalized. According to Jeremy Rancher, no injures appear to be life threatening.
The Greene County Sheriff’s Office is still interviewing witnesses to determine what took place and who is responsible. Anyone with information should contact the Greene County Sheriff’s Office at 205-372-3242.
